item.title: Health News Live December 18, 2024 : Yoga trends 2024: Desk yoga to eco-friendly practices, know the trends that ruled this year - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Yoga trends 2024: Desk yoga to eco-friendly practices, know the trends that ruled this year

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the major yoga trends that took center stage in 2024, focusing on how yoga has evolved to meet contemporary wellness needs.

  • Yoga enhances the connection between body and mind.
  • Desk yoga has gained popularity as a practical solution for office workers.
  • Eco-friendly practices within yoga are becoming more prevalent.
“Yoga in 2024 was more dynamic than ever, blending tradition with innovation to meet the needs of a fast-paced, wellness-focused world,” said yoga trainer Tanya Khanna.

The trends highlighted suggest a shift towards practices that integrate well-being into daily routines and embrace sustainability.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE 3rd Test, Day 5: Early Lunch Taken But Some Good News For Cricket Fans - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE 3rd Test, Day 5: Jasprit Bumrah Draws 1st Blood, Gets Rid Of Usman Khawaja

Publication Date: N/A | Source: NDTV

On the fifth day of the 3rd Test, Jasprit Bumrah made a significant impact by taking the wicket of Usman Khawaja, marking an exciting phase in the match between India and Australia.

  • Jasprit Bumrah initiated the breakthroughs for India on Day 5 by dismissing Usman Khawaja.
  • The match has seen competitive performances from both teams, with tension building up as they approach the final stages.
  • Bumrah’s wicket could change the momentum in favor of India.
“This wicket is crucial for our strategy moving forward in the match,” said a key player from the Indian team.

As the day progresses, all eyes are on the Indian bowlers to maintain their pressure and capitalize on this early success.

item.title: Pushpa 2 The Rule stampede: Show cause notice issued to theatre management after woman's death at Sandhya theatre - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pushpa 2 The Rule Stampede: Show Cause Notice Issued to Sandhya Theatre for '11 Lapses' After Woman's Death at Premiere

Publication Date: December 12, 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Hyderabad police has issued a show cause notice to Sandhya Theatre for lapses leading to a woman's death during the premiere of Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2'.

  • The notice outlines 11 alleged lapses by the theatre management.
  • Management failed to inform police about Allu Arjun's arrival, leading to crowd mismanagement.
  • No proper guidance for entry and exit points, encouraging crowd gathering without permission.
  • Inadequate security arrangements resulted in the tragic incident.
  • A case registered against Allu Arjun and theatre management following a complaint from the deceased woman's family.
  • A medical update indicated the boy injured in the incident is in stable condition but still requires intensive care.
“The neurological condition is severely impacted. The doctors have opined that it will be a long haul before any improvements can be seen.”

The incident has raised significant concerns about safety protocols at major events, highlighting the need for strict adherence to crowd management practices.

item.title: Not Laapataa Ladies, but this Hindi-language film made it to Oscars 2025 shortlist - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Hindi Film 'Santosh' Shortlisted for Oscars 2025

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Hindi-language international co-production, 'Santosh', has been nominated in the 'Best International Feature Film' category at the Oscars 2025. The film was submitted by the UK and premiered at the Cannes Film Festival in 2024.

  • The film is directed by Sandhya Suri and stars Shahana Goswami.
  • 'Santosh' explores themes of institutional corruption and is set in rural north India.
  • A total of 15 films made the shortlist out of 85 submissions worldwide.
  • Oscar voting for nominations begins on January 8, 2025.
“So happy for the team especially our writer-director Sandhya Suri for this little glory of recognition for our film Santosh!” - Shahana Goswami

This recognition marks a significant milestone for Indian cinema on an international platform.

item.title: 7 Viral images of celestial bodies by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - India.com
item.description:
7 Viral Images of Celestial Bodies by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Unknown

This article presents stunning viral images captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing celestial bodies and their intricate details.

  • FS Tau is a multi-star system featuring FS Tau A and FS Tau B.
  • The bright star-like object FS Tau A is prominently positioned in the center of the image.
  • FS Tau B is situated to the right, obscured by a dark vertical lane of dust.

item.title: Donald Trump's message to India over high tariffs: 'They tax us, we tax them' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Trump's Stance on High Tariffs: A Call for Reciprocity with India

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Donald Trump, in a recent statement, made it clear that fairness in trade is crucial, emphasizing that the United States will impose reciprocal tariffs on countries like India that impose high tariffs on American goods.

  • Trump plans to implement tariffs equivalent to those charged by other nations on US exports.
  • He expressed that if India charges a 100% tariff on US products, the US will respond similarly.
  • His comments were aimed at highlighting inequities in trade practices between the US and countries like India and Brazil.
“Reciprocal. If they tax us, we tax them the same amount,” Trump stated.

In conclusion, Trump's administration is likely to continue focusing on ensuring equitable trade practices and considering reciprocity in tariff policies, which may shape future US-India trade relations.

item.title: Gadkari among BJP MPs absent during 'One Nation, One Election' bills' LS introduction, party likely to issue notice - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP MPs Absence Raises Questions During 'One Nation, One Election' Bill Introduction

Publication Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The BJP plans to send notices to MPs absent during the introduction of bills related to the 'One Nation, One Election' initiative, including notable members like Nitin Gadkari.

  • The notices come after a three line whip was issued by the party.
  • Opposition members resisted the introduction of the bills, but a majority approved.
  • The bills will be discussed by a Joint Parliamentary Committee.
“While the government had large numbers on its side, it did not have the numbers required to pass the bills.” - Shashi Tharoor, Congress MP

This absence, although not jeopardizing the bill’s introduction, has provided the opposition with ammunition to criticize the BJP.

item.title: 'Killing intended to evoke terror': Luigi Mangione indicted for murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO - The Times of India
item.description:
Killing intended to evoke terror: Luigi Mangione indicted for murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Local News

Luigi Mangione has been indicted for the murder of the CEO of UnitedHealthcare, with authorities alleging that the killing was aimed at instilling fear.

  • Luigi Mangione is charged with the murder of a prominent healthcare executive.
  • The indictment claims that the murder was premeditated.
  • This incident has sparked significant concern over safety in the corporate healthcare sector.
"This tragic event serves as a grim reminder of the threats facing leaders in our society." - Local law enforcement spokesperson

The indictment of Mangione has raised alarms about violence aimed at business leaders, reflecting broader issues of safety and security in the workplace.

item.title: Prithvi Shaw's Instagram outburst backfires as youngster handed stern warning: 'Just by looking at his frame…' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prithvi Shaw Faces Criticism After Instagram Outburst

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prithvi Shaw, once the celebrated young talent in Indian cricket, has found himself under scrutiny after being dropped from Mumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad due to fitness and performance issues. Following his exclusion, he took to Instagram to defend himself by sharing his List-A statistics, admitting that he feels he is not good enough.

  • Shaw needs to improve his fitness and discipline after being omitted from the Vijay Hazare Trophy squad.
  • Despite once being dubbed the future star of Indian cricket, his opportunities have dwindled with only 12 international matches played.
  • Performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy was subpar, with an average below 25.
  • He went unsold in the IPL auction, raising further concerns about his career trajectory.
  • Coaches emphasize the need for hard work and commitment to realize his potential.
"Just by looking at his frame, the fitness issues are there for everyone to see." - Source from the Mumbai Cricket Association

In conclusion, Shaw's situation serves as a reminder of the delicate balance between talent and discipline in sports, highlighting the challenges athletes face in maintaining their careers amidst scrutiny.

item.description:
Sagittarius Daily Horoscope Today, December 18, 2024

Date: December 18, 2024 04:08 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Today's horoscope suggests expressing emotions freely and focusing on love life and professional responsibilities.

  • Consider safe developments in love with parental consent.
  • Professional responsibilities will be present, showcasing your skills.
  • Financial luck is on your side; focus on smart investments.
  • Caution is advised for those with health issues, especially in adventurous activities.

Notable Quotes

“Express your emotions freely and see the positive outcome.”

This horoscope presents a blend of positive predictions for career, love, and finance, urging individuals to take proactive steps for a better day.

item.title: All BJP-ruled states to have UCC, Congress wants to give quota to Muslims by raising limit: Amit Shah - The Indian Express
item.description:
Amit Shah's Critique of Congress on UCC and Reservations

Published on: Tuesday, Source: Indian Express

In a heated discussion in the Rajya Sabha, Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticized the Congress for its stance on the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and reservation policies, asserting that all BJP-ruled states will implement the UCC similar to Uttarakhand.

  • Shah emphasized the need for a uniform law for all communities, criticizing the Congress for maintaining separate personal laws.
  • He accused the Congress of trying to expand reservations for Muslims beyond the constitutional cap.
  • Shah defended the implementation of the UCC as aligned with constitutional principles.
  • He recalled past criticisms of the Congress regarding its historical handling of OBC reservations and constitutional amendments.
  • He lauded the Modi government's initiatives as pro-people changes enhancing social equity and justice.
“In a secular state, shouldn’t there be one law for all communities?” - Amit Shah

This debate highlights ongoing tensions between the ruling BJP and opposition Congress concerning social equity and legal reforms in India.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus images just leaked ahead of rumored Unpacked event - Tom's Guide
item.description:
Leaked Images of Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus Ahead of Unpacked Event

Publication Date: Not Specified
Source: Tom's Guide

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus has been spotted in leaked images, showcasing a familiar design ahead of its rumored launch event.

  • Leaked images show a rounded design similar to previous models like the Galaxy S24 and iPhone 16 Plus.
  • The Plus model appears to maintain a softer aesthetic despite past accusations of design copying from competitors like Apple.
  • New features may include a wider display and the upcoming Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset for improved performance.
  • Camera features are still partly hidden, but it's expected the Plus won't have the significant lens changes seen in the Ultra model.
"With the rounded corners, the S25 Plus appears to be very similar to the iPhone 16 Plus."

The S25 Plus is set to attract attention due to these recent leaks as users await official confirmation from Samsung.

item.title: Supreme Court collegium ticks off HC judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav for his speech at VHP event - The Times of India
item.description:
Supreme Court collegium ticks off HC judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav for his speech at VHP event

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Not specified

An internal review process was initiated by the Supreme Court collegium regarding remarks made by High Court judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav at a recent VHP event, raising questions about judicial conduct.

  • Judge Yadav's speech at the VHP event was criticized for appearing partisan.
  • The collegium expressed concerns over the implications of such remarks for judicial independence.
  • This incident highlights ongoing debates about the role of judges in public events.
"Judicial independence must remain unimpeachable and judges should not engage in politically charged contexts."

The scrutiny of Judge Yadav's participation reflects the judiciary's ongoing challenges in maintaining impartiality in a politically sensitive landscape.

item.description:
India's Oscar Aspirations: Guneet Monga's 'Anuja' Named in Final Shortlist for 2025, While Kiran Rao's 'Laapataa Ladies' Misses Out

This article discusses India's hopes for the Oscars as Guneet Monga's film 'Anuja' makes it to the final shortlist for the 2025 Academy Awards, while Kiran Rao's film 'Laapataa Ladies' fails to secure a spot.

  • Guneet Monga's 'Anuja' is recognized as a strong contender for the Oscars.

This year, India's selection process has ignited discussions around the evolving narrative of Indian films on the global stage.

item.title: Google joins Indian cricket fans to say: I only believe in Jassi Bhai - The Times of India
item.description:
Google joins Indian cricket fans to say: I only believe in Jassi Bhai

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

This article discusses actress Dipika Kakar's response to online trolls who criticized her for caring for her in-laws. Following her husband's health issues, she took to social media to defend her commitment to her family.

  • Dipika Kakar addresses trolls during a live session with husband Shoaib Ibrahim.
  • She emphasizes her loving relationship with her in-laws and her role in their care.
  • Kakar reacts to derogatory comments by urging critics to reconsider their attitudes towards family values.
“Sharam karo tum log. Uski privacy le li...I pity you guys and I am concerned about your elders...” - Dipika Kakar

Kakar's passionate defense highlights the importance of family support and challenges the stigma associated with traditional family roles in modern society.

item.title: One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced In Lok Sabha; 269 Members Vote In Favour, 198 Oppose - News18
item.description:
One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced In Lok Sabha; 269 Members Vote In Favour, 198 Oppose

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: News18

Two bills enabling simultaneous elections were introduced in the Lok Sabha after a heated debate, with 269 votes in favor and 198 against.

  • The Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024 and The Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024 were formally introduced.
  • The bills propose 'One Nation, One Election', or simultaneous elections to both Lok Sabha and state assemblies.
  • The government insists the bills are not an attack on federalism, as claimed by the opposition.
  • The measure now goes to a Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) for further discussion.
  • The electronic voting system was used in the Lok Sabha for the first time in the new Parliament House.
“The essential features are federalism and the structure of our democracy.” - Manish Tewari, Congress MP

As heated debates unfold, the proposed amendments may significantly alter India's electoral landscape.

item.title: Oscars 2025: India's Laapataa Ladies fails to feature in shortlist, out of Best International Feature category - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Oscars 2025: India's Laapataa Ladies Fails to Make Shortlist for Best International Feature

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Kiran Rao's film Laapataa Ladies (retitled Lost Ladies) has not been included in the shortlist for the Oscars 2025 in the Best International Feature category. Despite this setback, another Indian film has made it to the shortlist.

  • Laapataa Ladies was selected as India's official entry for the 97th Academy Awards.
  • The shortlist announcement took place on December 17, 2024.
  • Other films that made the shortlist include titles from Brazil, Canada, France, and the UK.
  • The film portrays the story of two young brides in rural India who get separated from their husbands.
“The film perfectly captured the diversity of Indian women.” - Jahnu Barua, Chair of the selection committee

In conclusion, although Laapataa Ladies has not made it to the Oscar shortlist, it reflects the rich narratives emerging from Indian cinema and the ongoing competition at the Academy Awards.

item.title: Elon Musk, Sundar Pichai react to Jasprit Bumrah's 'Google it' remark on his batting skills - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Elon Musk and Sundar Pichai React to Jasprit Bumrah's 'Google It' Remark

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

After Jasprit Bumrah's witty remark about his batting, Google CEO Sundar Pichai praised him on X, while Elon Musk added a brief compliment.

  • Jasprit Bumrah humorously suggested that a journalist should use Google to assess his batting skills.
  • Sundar Pichai praised Bumrah's batting performance, referencing a specific instance of his ability.
  • Elon Musk responded positively to Pichai's compliment.
  • Pichai suggested they watch a cricket match together in the future.
“I did Google it. Anyone who can hook Cummins for a six knows how to bat!” – Sundar Pichai

This exchange highlights the intersection of sports, technology, and celebrity, showcasing how public figures engage with culture.

item.title: SpaceX’s 31st Dragon cargo capsule returns to Earth with splashdown off Florida coast - Space.com
item.description:
SpaceX’s 31st Dragon cargo capsule returns to Earth with splashdown off Florida coast

Date: December 17, 2023
Source: Space.com

SpaceX's 31st robotic cargo mission has successfully returned to Earth.

The Dragon cargo capsule splashed down off the Florida coast at 1:39 p.m. EDT, bringing back thousands of pounds of equipment and experiment specimens from the International Space Station (ISS).

  • The capsule is the only ISS cargo spacecraft capable of returning equipment and experiments safely to Earth.
  • It launched from NASA's Kennedy Space Center on Nov. 4, delivering about 6,000 pounds of supplies for astronauts aboard the ISS.
  • The astronauts onboard include NASA’s Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who had extended stays due to complications with the Boeing Starliner mission.
  • The delivered cargo included fresh food, research equipment, and personal items for the astronauts.
NASA will retrieve the CRS-31 Dragon spacecraft relatively quickly to continue research in the post-microgravity environment.

This successful splashdown reaffirms the reliability of SpaceX's cargo missions and their importance in supporting ISS operations.

item.title: Google launches Whisk AI-image generator: How is different from others - The Times of India
item.description:
Google launches Whisk AI-image generator: How is different from others

Publication Date: October 10, 2023

Source: Tech News Daily

Google has unveiled its latest technology, the Whisk AI-image generator, which leverages advanced algorithms to create images that stand out from existing tools.

  • The Whisk AI-image generator uses deep learning methods to enhance image quality.
  • It offers innovative features that allow users to customize images more easily than similar platforms.
  • Google claims that Whisk produces images faster than competing generators.
  • A free version of the tool is available, making it accessible to users everywhere.
“Whisk is not just about creating images; it’s about reimagining how we visualize our ideas,” said a Google spokesperson.

This new launch positions Google at the forefront of AI-driven creativity tools, promising to reshape the image generation landscape.

item.title: Israel will remain at Hermon until 'another arrangement is found,' Netanyahu says during assessment - The Jerusalem Post
item.description:
Israel will remain at Hermon until 'another arrangement is found,' Netanyahu says during assessment

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: The Jerusalem Post

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu conducted a situational assessment on Tuesday at the Hermon Ridge with several senior defense officials, announcing that Israel would remain there until 'another arrangement is found.'

  • Netanyahu was accompanied by senior officials including Defense Minister Israel Katz and IDF Chief of Staff Herzi Halevi.
  • The assessment focused on Israel's military deployment in the area and its security strategy.
  • Netanyahu emphasized the importance of the Hermon location for Israel's security interests.
“We are here for a situational assessment to decide on Israel's deployment in this important location until another arrangement is found that ensures the security of the state.”

In conclusion, Netanyahu's visit highlights ongoing security evaluations essential for maintaining Israel's presence and strategy in the region.
